ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course if a student was interested in getting a broad picture of what the field bioinformatics entails.
Yes, and it's a required course as well
Yes, I would recommend as the course really covers a lot of knowledge in this field.
A good overview of different areas of bioinformatics

It's a good introduction to bioinformatics and a qualitative introduction to various machine learning techniques. I highly recommend the course, though if you already have a strong stats/ML background a more challenging course may be more appropriate.
Yes. I enjoyed the focus on conceptual approaches to key problems in computational biology.
CBB 752 is an easy class with boring lectures. I would not recommend it to other students because I do not feel like I was able to learn much in this course.
CBB 752 covers the basic computational methods used to find patterns in large biological data sets and model the structure of a biological molecule.
a must for modern biologists!need lots of after-class work on both computer science content and biology background

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course deepened my knowledge of the field by introducing me to protein folding simulations, a part of computational biology I had no prior experience with.
It exposed me to many aspects of computational biology that I had not previously been exposed to. Further, I learned more about the biology side of computational biology, i.e. experimental protocol.
It covered basically every aspect of the field of bioinformatics. Very useful in the curriculum.
It helped me build vocabularies in this field

This course gave me a very broad overview of bioinformatics which was helpful as I had only been previously aware of a few small aspects of the field. It provides me with a much better perspective from which to approach my research.
Improved my understanding of certain topics in computational biology.
This was a very useful class that I plan on incorporating in my PhD work here at Yale.
